title: Future Versions Roadmap
description: Long-term vision and planned features for Whizbang beyond v0.5.0

title: Architecture Overview
description: Explore Whizbang's layered architecture that scales from event-driven development to full distributed event-sourced systems with receptors, perspectives, lenses, and domain ownership.

title: Aspect-Oriented Programming in Whizbang
description: Comprehensive guide to Whizbang's aspect-oriented programming system powered by source generators

title: Event-Driven Architecture
description: Understanding Whizbang's Event-Driven and Event-Sourced modes - how the same code works in both paradigms

title: Whizbang Unified Vision
description: The unified architecture vision for Whizbang - combining the best of all messaging libraries with aspect-oriented programming

title: Core Concepts
description: Master the four foundational concepts of Whizbang - Events, Commands, Aggregates, and Projections - essential for building effective CQRS and event-sourced systems.

title: Dispatcher & Policies
description: The Dispatcher coordinates all message flow between receptors, perspectives, and lenses, with policies controlling behavior and execution strategies

title: Lenses
description: Lenses - read-only interfaces for querying data in Whizbang

title: Perspectives
description: Perspectives - how events create different views of your data in Whizbang

title: Receptors
description: Receptors - the universal pattern for receiving commands and making decisions in Whizbang

title: Return Type Semantics
description: How return types determine behavior in Whizbang - the foundation of convention over configuration

title: Getting Started
description: Learn how to build your first Whizbang application with this hands-on tutorial covering event-driven architecture, receptors, perspectives, lenses, and event sourcing from simple to scale.

description: Test page for new header and callout features

title: Aspect-Oriented Handlers
description: Implementing cross-cutting concerns through aspect-oriented programming with source generators

title: CQRS Implementation
description: Implement Command Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS) with Whizbang to separate read and write models for optimal performance

title: Distributed Messaging
description: Implement distributed messaging patterns with Whizbang for reliable communication across service boundaries

title: Event Sourcing Basics
description: Learn the fundamentals of event sourcing with Whizbang - storing state changes as events and rebuilding state through event replay

title: Microservices Integration
description: Build and deploy microservices with Whizbang and .NET Aspire for production-ready distributed systems

title: Policy Composition
description: Building resilient applications with composable policies for retry, circuit breaking, timeouts, and fallbacks

title: Progressive Enhancement
description: Scale your application from simple in-process to distributed event-sourced systems without changing handler code

title: Saga Orchestration
description: Implement saga patterns with Whizbang to orchestrate complex multi-step business processes with compensation

title: Event-Driven Dispatcher Pattern
description: Learn how to implement event-driven architecture with Whizbang using receptors, perspectives, and lenses

title: Proposed Features
description: Proposed features and documentation under consideration

title: Feature Evolution Matrix
description: Track how each feature evolves across versions with clear progression indicators

title: Whizbang Implementation Roadmap
description: Complete implementation roadmap for building the Whizbang .NET library from foundation to production

title: Session Context for Claude
description: Essential context for starting new Claude sessions on the Whizbang implementation

title: Architecture Overview
description: High-level architecture and component relationships in Whizbang

title: Implementation Philosophy
description: Core principles and philosophy driving the Whizbang implementation

title: Success Metrics
description: How we measure success for each version and component of Whizbang

title: Version 0.1.0 - Foundation Release
description: The foundation release of Whizbang establishing all core components with comprehensive testing and IDE support

title: Version 0.1.0 - Foundation
description: The foundation release establishing all core components with in-memory implementations

title: Core Components Overview
description: Overview of all core components in Whizbang v0.1.0

title: Dispatcher Component
description: Core message routing and orchestration with basic handler discovery

title: Drivers Component
description: Basic in-memory storage driver for development and testing

title: Ledger Component
description: In-memory event store with basic append and read operations

title: Lenses Component
description: Read-only interfaces for querying data - the query side of Whizbang's CQRS implementation

title: Perspectives Component
description: Event handlers that update various views of your data - the write side of Whizbang

title: Policy Engine Component
description: Cross-cutting concerns as composable policies - retry, timeout, cache, and circuit breaker

title: Receptors Component
description: Command receivers that make decisions and emit events - the foundation of Whizbang's event-driven architecture

title: Transports Component
description: Basic in-process message transport for local development

title: Version 0.2.0 - Event-Driven Enhancement
description: Enhanced event-driven capabilities with validation, rich events, and policy improvements

title: Pipeline & Middleware Dispatcher
description: Message pipeline with middleware, parallel execution, and handler prioritization

title: File Storage Drivers
description: Persistent file-based storage with JSON serialization and basic indexing

title: Ledger Persistence
description: File-based persistence, event streams, versioning, and snapshots

title: Policy Enhancements
description: Policy composition, bulkhead isolation, and rate limiting

title: HTTP & WebSocket Transports
description: REST APIs with HTTP transport and real-time communication via WebSockets

title: Version 0.3.0 - Event Sourcing
description: Add stateful capabilities with event sourcing, aggregates, and projections

title: Saga Orchestration & Workflows
description: Multi-step workflow orchestration with sagas, compensation, and process management

title: Event Sourcing & Projections
description: Full event sourcing with aggregates, projections, and time-travel queries

title: Stateful Policy Management
description: Persistent policy state, metrics, and dynamic configuration

title: Message Queue Transports
description: Enterprise messaging with RabbitMQ, Kafka, and Redis pub/sub

title: Version 0.4.0 - Real Persistence
description: Production-ready database persistence with PostgreSQL, SQL Server, and SQLite drivers

title: Database Drivers
description: Production database drivers for SQL and NoSQL with JSONB support

title: Version 0.5.0 - Distributed Systems
description: Enable distributed messaging with Kafka, RabbitMQ, and saga orchestration

title: Distributed Orchestration
description: Multi-region distributed saga orchestration with consensus and global coordination

title: Distributed Multi-Model Drivers
description: Cloud-native distributed drivers with multi-model support and automatic sharding

title: Distributed Event Store
description: Multi-region event store with replication, partitioning, and event streaming

title: Production Policy System
description: Distributed policy coordination, federation, and ML-based optimization

title: Cloud-Native Transports
description: Multi-cloud messaging with AWS SQS/SNS, Azure Service Bus, Google Pub/Sub, and global federation
